title: How to Get the Longshore Skull in Halo 3

steps.headline: Begin a Forge session on the Longshore map.
steps.description: This can be done by selecting the Forge from the main menu of the Halo: Complete Multiplayer Experience disc and selecting the Longshore map from the ones available. Gathering the Mythic skulls is infinitely easier when you are in a Forge session rather than Custom game, as this one cannot be reached without entering editor mode in Forge.

steps.headline: Enter editor mode (or oracle form) by pressing UP on the D-Pad once you have begun play.
steps.description: Make sure that if you are not host, that the player who is has enabled all players to be able to enter editor mode.

steps.headline: Go to the back of the map, next to the defenders base.
steps.description: The defenders base, the one with the machine-gun turret, is opposite the attackers base of the outer wharf and has an aircraft carrier behind it.

steps.headline: Locate the white garage door with "DO NOT BLOCK" printed on it, next to the defenders base.
steps.description: This is in the vicinity of the Longshore skull and will be on the second level of the defenders base, overlooking the water. The garage door is not difficult to see, especially when walking towards the defenders base via the alley with all the stacked crates in it.

steps.headline: Fly over the water to the left of the garage door until you reach an 'S' shaped, metal vent running down the back wall.
steps.description: The vent is directly to the left of the garage door and to the right of a large Fronk's fishery sign with a whale on it. The vent is located over water, so it is imperative you stay in editor mode while you find it.

steps.headline: Fly to the side of the vent, close to the wall, to where it connects to the building at the bottom.
steps.description: The Longshore skull will be resting there behind the vent, facing away from the main map.

steps.headline: Go around the vent until you can land on top of the skull.
steps.description: Change from editor mode back into player form by pressing UP on the D-Pad again, landing on the ledge where the skull is resting. Pick it up by pressing the Right Bunker when prompted and be careful not to fall off before you claim it. Congratulations, you just found the Longshore Skull!

steps.headline: Check your Xbox 360 gamerscore and achievement statistics and you will see that the Longshore Skull achievement has been unlocked for 25 gamerscore.
steps.description: It is represented by a skull with a harpooned fish on its' forehead.

text: Begin a Forge session on the Longshore map. This can be done by selecting the Forge from the main menu of the Halo: Complete Multiplayer Experience disc and selecting the Longshore map from the ones available. Gathering the Mythic skulls is infinitely easier when you are in a Forge session rather than Custom game, as this one cannot be reached without entering editor mode in Forge. Enter editor mode (or oracle form) by pressing UP on the D-Pad once you have begun play. Make sure that if you are not host, that the player who is has enabled all players to be able to enter editor mode. Go to the back of the map, next to the defenders base. The defenders base, the one with the machine-gun turret, is opposite the attackers base of the outer wharf and has an aircraft carrier behind it. Locate the white garage door with "DO NOT BLOCK" printed on it, next to the defenders base. This is in the vicinity of the Longshore skull and will be on the second level of the defenders base, overlooking the water. The garage door is not difficult to see, especially when walking towards the defenders base via the alley with all the stacked crates in it. Fly over the water to the left of the garage door until you reach an 'S' shaped, metal vent running down the back wall. The vent is directly to the left of the garage door and to the right of a large Fronk's fishery sign with a whale on it. The vent is located over water, so it is imperative you stay in editor mode while you find it. Fly to the side of the vent, close to the wall, to where it connects to the building at the bottom. The Longshore skull will be resting there behind the vent, facing away from the main map. Go around the vent until you can land on top of the skull. Change from editor mode back into player form by pressing UP on the D-Pad again, landing on the ledge where the skull is resting. Pick it up by pressing the Right Bunker when prompted and be careful not to fall off before you claim it. Congratulations, you just found the Longshore Skull! Check your Xbox 360 gamerscore and achievement statistics and you will see that the Longshore Skull achievement has been unlocked for 25 gamerscore. It is represented by a skull with a harpooned fish on its' forehead.
